channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Infinity: Scaling Bitwise AutoRegressive Modeling for High-Resolution Image Synthesis
item.description: We present Infinity, a Bitwise Visual AutoRegressive Modeling capable of generating high-resolution, photorealistic images following language instruction.

item.title: TransAdapter: Vision Transformer for Feature-Centric Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
item.description: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation (UDA) aims to utilize labeled data from a source domain to solve tasks in an unlabeled target domain, often hindered by significant domain gaps.

item.title: Unified Framework for Open-World Compositional Zero-shot Learning
item.description: Open-World Compositional Zero-Shot Learning (OW-CZSL) addresses the challenge of recognizing novel compositions of known primitives and entities.

item.title: PDG2Seq: Periodic Dynamic Graph to Sequence Model for Traffic Flow Prediction
item.description: To address these findings, this paper proposes a Periodic Dynamic Graph to Sequence Model (PDG2Seq) for traffic flow prediction.

item.title: ASIGN: An Anatomy-aware Spatial Imputation Graphic Network for 3D Spatial Transcriptomics
item.description: Expanding ST to three-dimensional (3D) volumes is challenging due to the prohibitive costs; a 2D ST acquisition already costs over 50 times more than whole slide imaging (WSI), and a full 3D volume with 10 sections can be an order of magnitude more expensive.

item.title: Alignment at Pre-training! Towards Native Alignment for Arabic LLMs
item.description: The alignment of large language models (LLMs) is critical for developing effective and safe language models.

item.title: BIMCaP: BIM-based AI-supported LiDAR-Camera Pose Refinement
item.description: This paper introduces BIMCaP, a novel method to integrate mobile 3D sparse LiDAR data and camera measurements with pre-existing building information models (BIMs), enhancing fast and accurate indoor mapping with affordable sensors.

item.title: Revolve: Optimizing AI Systems by Tracking Response Evolution in Textual Optimization
item.description: However, relying solely on such feedback can be limited when the adjustments made in response to this feedback are either too small or fluctuate irregularly, potentially slowing down or even stalling the optimization process.

item.title: Multi-Level Correlation Network For Few-Shot Image Classification
item.description: In this paper, we argue that measure at such a level may not be effective enough to generalize from base to novel classes when using only a few images.

item.title: A surprisal oracle for when every layer counts
item.description: Active Curriculum Language Modeling (ACLM; Hong et al., 2023) is a learner directed approach to training a language model.

item.title: AIM: Adaptive Inference of Multi-Modal LLMs via Token Merging and Pruning
item.description: With a minimalist design, our method can be applied to both video and image LLMs.

item.title: Sifting through the haystack -- efficiently finding rare animal behaviors in large-scale datasets
item.description: Our method consistently outperformed traditional random sampling, offering an average improvement of 70% in performance and creating datasets even when the behavior of interest was only 0. 02% of the data.

item.title: A Stitch in Time Saves Nine: Small VLM is a Precise Guidance for Accelerating Large VLMs
item.description: Vision-language models (VLMs) have shown remarkable success across various multi-modal tasks, yet large VLMs encounter significant efficiency challenges due to processing numerous visual tokens.

item.title: PrefixKV: Adaptive Prefix KV Cache is What Vision Instruction-Following Models Need for Efficient Generation
item.description: With an adaptive layer-wise KV retention recipe based on binary search, the maximum contextual information can thus be preserved in each layer, facilitating the generation.

item.title: Intuitive Axial Augmentation Using Polar-Sine-Based Piecewise Distortion for Medical Slice-Wise Segmentation
item.description: Most data-driven models for medical image analysis rely on universal augmentations to improve performance.

item.title: LuxEmbedder: A Cross-Lingual Approach to Enhanced Luxembourgish Sentence Embeddings
item.description: Sentence embedding models play a key role in various Natural Language Processing tasks, such as in Topic Modeling, Document Clustering and Recommendation Systems.

item.title: PatchDPO: Patch-level DPO for Finetuning-free Personalized Image Generation
item.description: To tackle this problem, this work proposes PatchDPO that estimates the quality of image patches within each generated image and accordingly trains the model.

item.title: Frequency-Guided Diffusion Model with Perturbation Training for Skeleton-Based Video Anomaly Detection
item.description: To this end, we propose a novel frequency-guided diffusion model with perturbation training, which enhances the model robustness by perturbation training and emphasizes the principal motion components guided by motion frequencies.

item.title: PBP: Post-training Backdoor Purification for Malware Classifiers
item.description: In recent years, the rise of machine learning (ML) in cybersecurity has brought new challenges, including the increasing threat of backdoor poisoning attacks on ML malware classifiers.

item.title: Learning Semantic Association Rules from Internet of Things Data
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel ARM pipeline for IoT data that utilizes both dynamic sensor data and static IoT system metadata.

item.title: Improving Linguistic Diversity of Large Language Models with Possibility Exploration Fine-Tuning
item.description: Although several fine-tuning and prompting techniques have been suggested to tackle the issue, they are often tailored to specific tasks or come with a substantial increase in computational cost and latency.

item.title: Robust Multi-bit Text Watermark with LLM-based Paraphrasers
item.description: To embed our multi-bit watermark, we use two paraphrasers alternatively to encode the pre-defined binary code at the sentence level.

item.title: Mapping using Transformers for Volumes -- Network for Super-Resolution with Long-Range Interactions
item.description: This advantage is especially pronounced for images that are larger than what is seen in popularly used 3D datasets.

item.title: Freshness and Informativity Weighted Cognitive Extent and Its Correlation with Cumulative Citation Count
item.description: In this paper, we revisit cognitive extent, originally defined as the number of unique phrases in a quota.

item.title: Pre-trained Multiple Latent Variable Generative Models are good defenders against Adversarial Attacks
item.description: Attackers can deliberately perturb classifiers' input with subtle noise, altering final predictions.

item.title: Evaluating the Relationship of EV Charging Station on the Uptake of Electric Vehicles -- Implication of the NEVI Formula Program
item.description: To achieve the federal goal to make half of all new vehicles sold in the U. S. in 2030 zero-emissions vehicles, the U. S. Department of Transportation's (DOT) Federal Highway Administration (FHWA) has employed the National Electric Vehicle Infrastructure (NEVI) Formula Program, which aims to promote an interconnected network of publicly accessible electric vehicle (EV) charging stations.

item.title: Distilling Diffusion Models to Efficient 3D LiDAR Scene Completion
item.description: To improve completion quality, we also introduce a novel $\textbf{Structural Loss}$, which encourages the distilled model to capture the geometric structure of the 3D LiDAR scene.

item.title: Stain-aware Domain Alignment for Imbalance Blood Cell Classification
item.description: In real-world scenarios, blood cell image datasets often present the issues of domain shift and data imbalance, posing challenges for accurate blood cell identification.

item.title: Weighted-Reward Preference Optimization for Implicit Model Fusion
item.description: To address distributional deviations between the source and target LLMs, WRPO introduces a progressive adaptation strategy that gradually shifts reliance on preferred examples from the target LLM to the source LLMs.

item.title: GERD: Geometric event response data generation
item.description: Event-based vision sensors are appealing because of their time resolution, higher dynamic range, and low-power consumption.

item.title: Composed Image Retrieval for Training-Free Domain Conversion
item.description: This work addresses composed image retrieval in the context of domain conversion, where the content of a query image is retrieved in the domain specified by the query text.

item.title: Tight PAC-Bayesian Risk Certificates for Contrastive Learning
item.description: The resulting bounds for contrastive loss and downstream prediction are much tighter than those of previous risk certificates, as demonstrated by experiments on CIFAR-10.

item.title: Gaussian Processes for Probabilistic Estimates of Earthquake Ground Shaking: A 1-D Proof-of-Concept
item.description: This proof-of-concept illustrates the importance of probabilistic methods for physics-based seismic hazard analysis.

item.title: Testing Neural Network Verifiers: A Soundness Benchmark with Hidden Counterexamples
item.description: In recent years, many neural network (NN) verifiers have been developed to formally verify certain properties of neural networks such as robustness.

item.title: Integrating Generative AI into Art Therapy: A Technical Showcase
item.description: This paper explores the integration of generative AI into the field of art therapy.

item.title: TASR: Timestep-Aware Diffusion Model for Image Super-Resolution
item.description: Our method enhances the transmission of LR information in the early stages of diffusion to guarantee image fidelity and stimulates the generation ability of the SD model itself more in the later stages to enhance the detail of generated images.

item.title: FLAIR: VLM with Fine-grained Language-informed Image Representations
item.description: CLIP has shown impressive results in aligning images and texts at scale.

item.title: Fine-Grained Behavior Simulation with Role-Playing Large Language Model on Social Media
item.description: In this paper, we introduce \textbf{FineRob}, a novel fine-grained behavior simulation dataset.

item.title: RFSR: Improving ISR Diffusion Models via Reward Feedback Learning
item.description: We posit that introducing reward feedback learning to finetune the existing models can further improve the quality of the generated images.

item.title: Pay Attention to the Robustness of Chinese Minority Language Models! Syllable-level Textual Adversarial Attack on Tibetan Script
item.description: This method is also used to evaluate the robustness of NLP models.

item.title: ASANet: Asymmetric Semantic Aligning Network for RGB and SAR image land cover classification
item.description: Most existing studies on cross-modal fusion assume that consistent feature information is necessary between the two modalities, and as a result, they construct networks without adequately addressing the unique characteristics of each modality.

item.title: Active Learning via Classifier Impact and Greedy Selection for Interactive Image Retrieval
item.description: Finally, we assess our performance for the interactive content-based image retrieval task on several benchmarks and demonstrate its superiority over existing approaches and common baselines.

item.title: LoCo: Low-Contrast-Enhanced Contrastive Learning for Semi-Supervised Endoscopic Image Segmentation
item.description: The segmentation of endoscopic images plays a vital role in computer-aided diagnosis and treatment.

item.title: Generalizing Weisfeiler-Lehman Kernels to Subgraphs
item.description: Subgraph representation learning has been effective in solving various real-world problems.

item.title: Gaussian Object Carver: Object-Compositional Gaussian Splatting with surfaces completion
item.description: 3D scene reconstruction is a foundational problem in computer vision.

item.title: On Simplifying Large-Scale Spatial Vectors: Fast, Memory-Efficient, and Cost-Predictable k-means
item.description: Experiments show that when simplifying datasets with scale such as $10^6$, Dask-means uses less than $30$MB of memory, achieves over $168$ times speedup compared to the widely-used Lloyd's algorithm.

item.title: Trajectory-based Road Autolabeling with Lidar-Camera Fusion in Winter Conditions
item.description: Robust road segmentation in all road conditions is required for safe autonomous driving and advanced driver assistance systems.

item.title: Agri-LLaVA: Knowledge-Infused Large Multimodal Assistant on Agricultural Pests and Diseases
item.description: By open-sourcing our dataset and model, we aim to promote research and development in LMMs within the agricultural domain and make significant contributions to tackle the challenges of agricultural pests and diseases.

item.title: SimuScope: Realistic Endoscopic Synthetic Dataset Generation through Surgical Simulation and Diffusion Models
item.description: This simulator generates a wide set of annotations that surpass those available in public synthetic datasets.

item.title: ShadowHack: Hacking Shadows via Luminance-Color Divide and Conquer
item.description: Shadows introduce challenges such as reduced brightness, texture deterioration, and color distortion in images, complicating a holistic solution.
